intro: Ctenium americanum, commonly known as American ctenium, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows to a height of 1 to 3 feet, featuring slender stems and small, compound leaves. Its flowers are small and clustered in umbels, typical of the Apiaceae family. The plant is often found in moist, sandy soils along stream banks and in open woodlands.
